question: Two lines (x-x<sub>1</sub>)/a<sub>1</sub> = (y-y<sub>1</sub>)/b<sub>1</sub> = (z-z<sub>1</sub>)/c<sub>1</sub> and (x-x<sub>2</sub>)/a<sub>2</sub> = (y-y<sub>2</sub>)/b<sub>2</sub> = (z-z<sub>2</sub>)/c<sub>2</sub> are coplanar if
options: \begin{vmatrix} x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 1
\begin{vmatrix} x_2+x_1 & y_2+y_1 & z_2+z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x_1 & y_1 & z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
answer: \begin{vmatrix} x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0

question: For two planes a<sub>1</sub>x + b<sub>1</sub>y + c<sub>1</sub>z + d<sub>1</sub> = 0 and a<sub>2</sub>x + b<sub>2</sub>y + c<sub>2</sub>z + d<sub>2</sub> = 0, origin will lie in acute angle between planes if

options: \begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x+x_1 & y+y_1 & z+z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0
answer: \begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ a_1 & b_1 & c_1 \\ a_2 & b_2 & c_2 \end{vmatrix} = 0

question: The equation of a plane passing through point A (x<sub>1</sub>, y<sub>1</sub>, z<sub>1</sub>), B (x<sub>2</sub>, y<sub>2</sub>, z<sub>2</sub>) and parallel to a line with direction ratios a, b, c is
options: \begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x+x_1 & y+y_1 & z+z_1 \\ x_2+x_1 & y_2+y_1 & z_2+z_1 \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix} = 0
\begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix} = 1
\begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix} = 0
answer: \begin{vmatrix} x-x_1 & y-y_1 & z-z_1 \\ x_2-x_1 & y_2-y_1 & z_2-z_1 \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix} = 0
